title: Millwall close to naming Gary Rowett as their new manager 'within next 48 hours'
text:
Millwall have edged closer to appointing their new manager, after Gary Rowett has reportedly emerged as the prime contender for the vacancy.

The Championship club are on the hunt for a new boss after Neil Harris quit his position at the helm in early October.

Former Stoke, Derby, Birmingham and Burton boss is the No 1 choice and a move to install him as manager could be completed within 48 hours, according to reports in The Sun.

Gary Rowett appears on course to become the next first team manager of Millwall

Rowett, 45, has been working as a TV pundit since being axed by Stoke in January though is understood to have been searching for a route back to the dug-out.

Rowett's most prominent role in recent times came during his Birmingham stint, where he guided the club to a healthy position before being axed for the star name arrival of Gianfranco Zola.

The Italian left St Andrews after less than five months in the role.

Rowett could be in charge by Saturday, and would come up against his former club Stoke

Wycombe manager Gareth Ainsworth was also reportedly interviewed by the club

It is reported that Rowett was shortlisted for the Millwall position alongside Wycombe boss Gareth Ainsworth and Lions' current first-team coach Adam Barrett.

All three men undertook an interview last week, after which a club source disclosed to the Sun that Rowett was 'the best candidate'.

Should negotiations be concluded swiftly Rowett could be in charge by Saturday and Millwall happen to host his most recent club Stoke.
description: Millwall have edged closer to appointing their new manager, after Gary Rowett emerged as the prime contender for the vacancy.
